title: py-rocket-geospatial-2: a Docker image for Python-R Geospatial
description:
The py-rocket-geospatial-2 Docker image is a geospatial, earth-science-oriented scientific computing environment designed for large-scale data analysis in JupyterHub deployments. It targets cloud-native and big-data workflows commonly used in oceanography, climate science, hydrology, and remote sensing.

The image builds on design patterns from the Pangeo ecosystem and provides an integrated Python and R environment optimized for array-based, spatiotemporal datasets and scalable analysis.

This image includes:

  • Python with an earth-science geospatial stack suited for large datasets and cloud-native workflows (e.g., array-based analysis, distributed computing, and object storage access)
  • R with RStudio and geospatial R packages, installed using Rocker Project installation scripts
  • JupyterLab with support for both Python and R notebooks
  • Desktop environment with VNC for graphical tools commonly used in earth-science workflows (e.g., QGIS, Panoply)
  • VS Code OSS with extensions optimized for scientific notebooks and Quarto
  • Publishing tools including Quarto, JupyterBook, MyST, Pandoc, and TeX Live
  • pyrocket_scripts to assist with common customization and extension tasks
  • rocker_scripts to support R and RStudio environment setup

The image is tailored for users working with NASA Earthdata and other large earth-observation archives, including workflows that authenticate and access data programmatically (e.g., via earthaccess). It is intended to lower barriers for reproducible, cloud-ready analysis of large earth-system datasets in shared JupyterHub environments.

Rocker installation scripts are licensed under GPL-2.0-or-later and retain their original license; the resulting container is licensed under Apache-2.0.
